website_summaries.verdict: Sinks into the pores of your equipment to provide season-long performance.
pros: Works well for both wintertime and springtime conditions, 5°F to 35°F
Customers appreciate that not much scraping needed for a smooth finish
Feels and looks homemade but performs like a pro

customer_reviews.title: Great winter wax, but not quite "all-temp."
customer_reviews.text: Great wax when used strictly in the temperature range specified. This is an obvious point, but one worth mentioning as some buyers may see "all-temp" and not look past that. If you typically ride in a region that is warmer in general (Lake Tahoe for example), you may want to consider a wax that works better in warmer temperatures when that time comes as this wax doesn't glide too well in springtime conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Lilly

customer_reviews.title: Jury is still out. I used this wax for ...
customer_reviews.text: Jury is still out. I used this wax for a relatively warm day at Beaver Creek and the wax seemed REALLY slow. Put more simply, I generally leave most everyone behind on cat tracks because of my weight and ski length but my daughter's friend who's half my weight with short skis which haven't been waxed in forever left me in the dust this time around. Is that a scientific review? Of course not but nobody actually provides those so at least I'm somewhat reviewing the actual performance ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Specter

customer_reviews.title: ... using Purl wax for a few seasons and really like it. It leaves a hard
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Purl wax for a few seasons and really like it. It leaves a hard, slick surface after scraping and buffing. Recently took two boards out: one I did with Purl and the other from a shop after a stone grind and another well known wax. The Purl board felt so much faster. Tag line should be "Faster than you and other waxes." Like other Purl reviews, it does take a bit more muscle to scrape off, but I think it is well worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: The Dude

customer_reviews.title: Great wax - great value
customer_reviews.text: Wax works very well. Really have nothing to compare it to but I can say that it made a huge difference vs riding unwaxed skis. I ski park primarily so I hit rails all the time. Quick hot wax with this stuff before a sticky powder day makes me fly down the mountain vs being stuck and barely moving. This brick of was is HUGE and is great value. I waxed my skis like 3 times already and barely used a tiny corner of it. Should last a handful of seasons.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Libby

customer_reviews.title: Best price for the most wax! Can't beat this deal!
customer_reviews.text: As an avid snowboarder who likes to put in the time to take care of his own stuff and make it last I highly recommend this block. After comparing a ton of different prices and brands I found that this gets you the most for your money. 20 bucks for a 1 lb block is the best price that you will find for snowboarding wax ANYWHERE. I am yet to find a better deal. This will last me for at least 3 seasons easily and I wax my board before almost every trip. Never heard of Purl before this but it sure is a hidden gem.
customer_reviews.author: j. hickey

customer_reviews.title: Best all around wax.  My whole ski school uses it.
customer_reviews.text: I have used purl wax for years and its always great. There is just no better all around wax, and I feel like I've tried everything. There might be better wax if you want to do ski racer science: measuring the moisture content or the snow and waxing everyday based on the temperature, but I don't have time for that. The purple purl is easy to apply, easy to scrape and never leaves me regretting that I used the wrong wax.
customer_reviews.author: SnA

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used it in a verity of temperatures and conditions. I’m in the Northeast so we can have nothing but ice or powder all depends on which way the wind blows. It holds up nice. On powder I’ll last all week on ice it’s good for two days esp on the edges. I’ll def recommend this product and will buy again in a few years when this 1lbs brick is gone.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Worked on my snowboard - easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I'm inexperienced at tuning my own snowboard but a friend helped me, using this wax and it turned out great. We used an old iron (like you iron your clothes with) and dribbled it on the board, then ironed it out smooth and used a plastic wax scraper to even it out. Still had a lot left over for next time.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Hard to scrape, slow in spring
customer_reviews.text: This wax is not that great. First off, it is very firm and therefore does not set or scrape well. Second, it is really bad in spring conditions and therefore not "All temp".. I switched from Dakine's regular All-temp wax to this, and there was a huge drop off in speed, and ease of use (and dakine doesn't exactly have a stellar reputation).
customer_reviews.author: joeydeeez

customer_reviews.title: The other reviews were right.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this and support a local shop but the wax isn't that good. I had to use a metal scraper to shave the wax off and the wax lasted 1 day. Also if the temp outside is colder than 30, the board sticks to the snow.
customer_reviews.author: If can can

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money and great wax
customer_reviews.text: This is great wax beloved fell in love with it years ago when I found it at a local shop. I'll live in Colorado and ski the Rockies but this is the only wax I use. This is the big block and I apply it to all of my skis my family skis as well.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Big, bold and beautiful.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this yet but I thought I'd snap a picture so you could see how big this block actually is. There are two quarters for reference. I've heard mostly positive things about Purl and I'm anxious to use it. I'll post further review after I've had a chance to apply it and use it.
customer_reviews.author: Unauthenticated

customer_reviews.title: A ‘GREEN’ PRODUCT,
customer_reviews.text: Not sending it back, but will use only as a ‘storage’ wax! Not the ‘real deal’. No ski competitor would ever use this stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Virgil Gassoway

customer_reviews.title: Super Fast and long Lasting!!
customer_reviews.text: This Wax is super Fast and Long lasting!!! I've used it off & on for year now and was stoked to find some 1 lbs bricks available. I was stoked that each brick I bought even came with a fresh scotch pad for buffing at the end after scraping. I highly recommend Pearl Wax to any Skier or Snowboarder!!
customer_reviews.author: Philip Johnston god dad sees

customer_reviews.title: Not that hard to scrape
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my snowboard before a Colorado trip. Not as hard to scrape as I expected from reviews. I used a metal scraper and it took some time but came off without too much effort. Very runny when melted.
customer_reviews.author: CP.

customer_reviews.title: Top notch
customer_reviews.text: Works great, still have 3/4 of the brick after a several multi board wax sessions. Seems high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Patrick Gillespie

customer_reviews.title: Best wax without fluorocarbons
customer_reviews.text: Great wax that destroys my friends on the slopes and powder. Also does not pollute the local watershed with fluorocarbons!
customer_reviews.author: Steven C.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, price and prompt shipping.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Purl wax purchased localy and paying retail. With this purchase I saved a lot. It was shipped very quickly and came with a large buffing pad for base finish.
customer_reviews.author: J H

customer_reviews.title: The ski wax is just as good as anything I've got in the last 16 years
customer_reviews.text: The ski wax is just as good as anything I've got in the last 16 years. Best in temperatures above 15 degrees farrnhight. I have a feeling that I won't have to buy ski wax for the rest of my life after this buy.
customer_reviews.author: Colton B.

customer_reviews.title: This is the first wax I've used on my own ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the first wax I've used on my own, so take my review with a grain of salt. It far surpasses whatever the heck the place I was taking our boards to was using. Has lasted long and done well across a number of conditions (Colorado dry, Minnesota slop and ice).
customer_reviews.author: Clark D. Starr Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great wax for the money
customer_reviews.text: Item is a fantastic wax. I also use the blue (cold) and yellow (warm) wax from Purl. It is a great alternative to swix or other money brand waxes and I find that by waxing my own gear I get a better result than the on-mountain tune shop. Seller also included a buffing pad to my surprise. Great product, great service, 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Great Wax 1
customer_reviews.text: The wax showed up in time, got the iron out and started waxing. The wax adheres very well, it was almost difficult to get the scrape started but it did. It covered and soaked in very well. The end result was my skis were fast and retained wax at the end of the day. GREAT PRODUCT!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Damian

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Wax
customer_reviews.text: Excellent wax. We bought it since it's from our lovely home state of awesome skiing/riding - Colorado! It is a nice big block of wax for the price. We skied all of last week and cruised around nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly and Michelle McClure

customer_reviews.title: If you ain’t first, yer last.
customer_reviews.text: This wax is gucci. Buddies can’t keep up thanks to this wax. 95% wax 5% skill.
customer_reviews.author: Niko

customer_reviews.title: Best priced wax I can find and seems to work ...
customer_reviews.text: Best priced wax I can find and seems to work great so far. Plus environmentally friendly product, no polluting chemicals.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like this wax
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good all around/universal ski wax. Used it in both very firm, powder and packed powder conditions and it worked beautifully. Vendor also shipped promptly and followed up.
customer_reviews.author: M2quared

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Easy enough to apply and has held well in cold and warm condictions.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent wax. I don't even scrape it, just let the snow polish it off for me.

customer_reviews.title: it isn't great, but cheap
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived quickly. The wax is okay, it isn't great, but cheap...

customer_reviews.title: same way i like my.
customer_reviews.text: Big and cheap. same way i like my.... ski resorts. Waxed my boards quite a few times with this and its pretty fast and stays on the board good
customer_reviews.author: Brendon Hatch

customer_reviews.title: Good wax but I guess I didn't read the the ...
customer_reviews.text: Good wax but I guess I didn't read the the size. Didn't realize how big they were. Makes for waxing the board a little difficult because they are big.
customer_reviews.author: Zilly

customer_reviews.title: Hardens like a rock
customer_reviews.text: This stuff hardens like a rock onto your skis. Scraping off the excess wax after the final waxing was quite the chore!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Murawski

customer_reviews.title: Great Wax, Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: I already knew I liked Purl wax because I'd bought a rather small chunk of it in a ski shop for nearly the same price as this big one pound block. This is a fabulous price, even with shipping added on. I like this wax better than all the others I've tried, it goes on well and scrapes off easily, and it holds up well on my skis. I haven't seen the need to mess with different temperature waxes, this one works great in all temperatures in my experience. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: CMCM

customer_reviews.title: Lasts a long time and is very fast. Only ...
customer_reviews.text: Lasts a long time and is very fast. Only qualm is the difficulty in scraping, but just keep your plexi scraper sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the price. My skis are gliding over the snow and there's no more sticking on the traverses .
customer_reviews.author: Robin Chaffey

customer_reviews.title: Great Wax, Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: This wax has been great in most conditions, and mixes well with other temp/moisture specific waxes. I have about 15 uses out of it, and it's only half gone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as fast as others have claimed in my experience ...
customer_reviews.text: Not as fast as others have claimed in my experience but we all know that depends on the snow temp. Overall, I will ride it through the season.
customer_reviews.author: Scott D Miller III

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Good value for the price. We use thefor skis and snowboards for all around temp here in Northern California Sierra Mountain snows. It gets warm here and slightly below freezing. It applies easily and costs about 5.5 cents per gram, one of the best deals around. I will be ordering more since we use it between 5 people who use both skis and snowboards. My kids also have their friends come over to wax their skis/boards. But I do hide the more expensive wax for racing, which is slightly noticeable compared to this Purl All Temp Wax. Fast shipping. Good seller.
customer_reviews.author: ANNETTA M FOX

customer_reviews.title: I did have good results this past winter through a wide range of ...
customer_reviews.text: Although it's summer now, I did have good results this past winter through a wide range of temps.l

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great value!
customer_reviews.text: Novice snowboarder only go out a couple times per year but, this wax is awesome! Amazing value compared to other wax I've seen and it worked wonders on my board. Buffing pad included!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: It got to me fast, the price was good, and it's biodegradable. All my criteria were met.
customer_reviews.author: Alec Weber

customer_reviews.title: Easy to apply
customer_reviews.text: Easy to apply to skis and boards, melts quickly at 150degrees with waxing iron. Good value if you have family of skiers that require frequent waxing on their skis and boards.
customer_reviews.author: ski lover

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Goes on & off easier than SWIX
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Goes on & off easier than SWIX. And a lot cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: WB

customer_reviews.title: Purl wax is great.
customer_reviews.text: I worked as a ski tech in the 70's (been skiing since the 60's) and have probably tuned and waxed thousands of pairs of skis. I've used Purl on a few trips now, all at moderate temperatures of 20 to 25 degrees, and it works just fine. If you're not a professional racer or skiing in below zero temps, this wax should be all you ever need. Heck, it might even be ok at below zero, but I don't live in Montana anymore, so don't ski in cold weather anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Brurud

customer_reviews.title: Great wax
customer_reviews.text: This is great wax at a great price and they threw in a buffing pad!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Martin

customer_reviews.title: Good wax. But hard to scrape off
customer_reviews.text: Good wax. But hard to scrape off. Gave me a good shoulder and forearm workout. But the end result was great. My snowboard was a lot faster and was able to go through the flat spots at the resort with ease. No need to skate through them. temperature was at around 50-55 sunny day. This was used on a sintered base board so the wax should hold up for a few days for riding.
customer_reviews.author: JWhitworth

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good...
customer_reviews.text: An acceptable all-purpose wax, but one of the more difficult to scrape.

customer_reviews.text: I bought it for next year. I will try it hopefully next November. I like the color. Snow is all gone in central Minnesota now.
